title: As it happened: UK hit by wintry weather - BBC News
summary: england 's east coast escapes significant flood damage .
thousands of homes evacuated in norfolk , suffolk , lincolnshire and essex .
seventeen severe flood warnings remain in place .
icy conditions expected across the uk .

documents.title: storm surge updates : here 's what happened
text: thanks for joining us for our live updates covering the predicted storm surges and flooding along the east coast of england and icy weather across the rest of the uk .

documents.title: 17 severe flood warnings remain
text: the environment agency said 17 severe flood warnings - where there is a danger to life - remain in place .
a further 80 flood warnings and 69 flood alerts are also active across england and wales .
its online flood map is updated every 15 minutes with the latest information .

documents.title: icy weather conditions expected
text: this is the met office 's latest weather warning for the uk .
ice is likely to form on untreated surfaces , particularly where showers of sleet , snow and hail occur .
the met office said the conditions may lead to a risk of disruption with difficult driving conditions .

documents.title: no reports of flooding in essex
text: there have been no reports of flooding along the coast of jaywick in essex where 230 residents were evacuated from their homes .
essex police said evacuating the residents was `` the right thing to do '' and was based on advice from the environment agency and the met office .
the county council was expected to arrange transport to take people back to their homes at around 6:00 bst , the police added .

documents.title: 'safe to return home ' in suffolk
text: residents along the coast south of lowestoft in suffolk have been told it is safe to return to their homes following the flood risk .
there had been some flooding along the east coast but the extent was `` not as bad as it may have been '' , said suffolk police .
but it added that there were some road closures in place in the southwold area which may affect residents ' ability to return home .

documents.title: 'safe to return home '
text: residents at the rescue centre in jaywick have been told it is safe to go home as the severe flood warning is over .
high tide has now passed and residents now safe to return home .
thanks to residents for their cooperation

documents.title: sea wall has not been breached in jaywick
text: we 've just heard the sea wall in jaywick has not been breached .
the confirmation came from ch insp jonathan baldwin , who said although there had not yet been flooding , the danger had not yet passed .
a severe flood warning is still in place for the coast from clacton to lee wick .

documents.title: great yarmouth evacuation 'not an overreaction '
text: evacuating homes and getting in help from other parts of the country was not an overreaction to the flood risk , the leader of great yarmouth council says .
about 4,500 people are thought to have left their homes ahead of a predicted tidal surge , but the town escaped unscathed and no flooding occurred .
`` we 're very grateful to all the people from all over the country who came here to help us , '' graham plant said .
`` i do n't believe we overreacted if [ the water ] had breached , the residents would have been so grateful to have those people there to help them . ''
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: 'we survived ! '
text: many residents in great yarmouth expressed their relief as it appeared they had escaped the worst of the flooding .
we survived !
# floodgate is over , thank you for your concern and support throughout this terrifying time .
# greatyarmouth

documents.title: 'the tide started to take him '
text: norfolk police has said the man arrested after jumping into a river in great yarmouth had been asked to move away for his own safety .
officers were alerted to a man acting dangerously next to the river yare near haven bridge at around 21:10 gmt .
he was rescued from the water and arrested for public order offences .
`` i saw officer grab the man as tide started to take him down river . ''
saved man who jumped into river is arrested -
charged with endangering others ' lives ?

documents.title: trapped fisherman pulled from pier
text: a fisherman had to be rescued by a lifeboat crew after being cut off by huge waves on a pier during the tidal surge .
the rnli crew at blyth was called just after 16:00 gmt to reports of a man stranded on the east pier near the lighthouse .

text: live : reporting from the scene at jaywick evacuation rest centre
author: Stuart Woodward
BBC Essex

documents.title: bridge closures in suffolk
text: suffolk police have closed the bascule bridge in lowestoft and mutford lock bridge in oulton due to safety concerns .
`` the decision has not been taken lightly but is being put in place for public safety as a precautionary measure , '' the force said .
the bridges are shut to pedestrians and cars `` while the danger passes . ''
# lowestoft update - bascule bridge & mutford lock bridge will close from 8pm this evening as high tide approaches -
police are taking reports of # flooding in caldecott road area of oulton broad and nr mutford lock bridge .
bridge remains closed .
any news on lowestoft bridge re opening .
thanks
hi shaun , the bascule bridge in lowestoft is now open .
at this time mutford lock bridge in oulton broad remains closed .
many thanks

documents.title: man arrested for jumping in flood-risk river
text: a man has been arrested for public order offences after he jumped into the river in great yarmouth , police say .
he was `` acting dangerously '' next to the river yare , but refused to move away from the water .
police said he was immediately rescued and arrested , but that `` a small number of people '' were getting too close to the water .

documents.title: high tide in great yarmouth
text: the bbc 's ben brown in great yarmouth says that despite the high tide coming in , there 's no sign of any flooding so far .
the environment agency has issued 17 severe flood warnings - meaning there is a danger to life .

documents.title: train cancellations
text: rail services from lowestoft station have now ended and are cancelled until saturday .
no trains from # lowestoft until tomorrow now due to a predicted tidal surge .

documents.title: people delay rescue over 'fear of being burgled '
text: `` some # jaywick residents tell me they delayed coming to rescue centre for fear of being burgled , '' bbc essex 's stuart woodward reports
it 's happened so many time before - the police do not protect the empty houses so you can not blame them for staying
in my blog of dec 2015 floods , i argued looting during disasters is v rare & one of many disaster myths
i can understand tht .
god help the professionals if got it sooooo wrong .
i 'm not surprised !
one of the roughest areas in britain !
i wouldnt believe authorities would look after my home if lived there .

documents.title: residents shun evacuation centres
text: news correspondent alex dunlop in great yarmouth , norfolk , says many residents have refused to go to emergency centres despite the flood warning .
police say that around 60 % to 70 % of the residents they visited did not want to go to the centres , out of around 5,000 properties .
this could be because they have decided to stay at home , or with a friend or relative .

documents.title: officials warn against 'flood selfies '
text: keep away from the coast tonight .
trying to be rescued from a flooding situation is a very difficult thing indeed , please do not play chance with your lives - it really is extremely dangerous to be taking selfies .
these large waves can come in very quickly and sweep you out .

documents.title: tidal surge passes skegness
text: news correspondent danny savage says the east coast tidal surge passed skegness , lincs , without incident .

documents.title: army helping in skegness and great yarmouth
text: the ministry of defence says burma company , 2nd battalion the yorkshire regiment , are supporting the authorities in skegness until at least 4:00 gmt tomorrow .
in great yarmouth , a squadron , king 's royal hussars , is supporting the authorities until early tomorrow .
high tide is expected there at 23:41 .

road closure in place on south promenade .

documents.title: 'take this surge seriously '
text: clearly these 17 severe flood warnings are a real indication that people need to take this surge seriously .
i want to encourage people to respond to the calls for people , where they are at risk , to stay with friends or family or at rest centres .
our priority is making sure people are safe tonight and that lives are saved .

documents.title: evacuations in norfolk
text: about 80 people are being evacuated from the village of walcott , norfolk police say .
in salthouse , about 15 properties were being evacuated , the force added .

documents.title: 'evacuate immediately '
text: we have seen numbers of people using the rest centres in jaywick increase steadily during the late afternoon .
i know from talking to many people that friends and family are also housing many more people .
i still need anyone who has not yet evacuated their property to do so immediately .
the flood warning for high tide after midnight remains at severe and there is a threat to life as a result .
officers will remain on patrol in jaywick , mistley and west mersea through the night to keep both locations safe and encourage residents to evacuate . ''

documents.title: continue evacuating , say essex police
text: residents of jaywick , mistley and west mersea in essex should continue evacuating their homes , essex police says .
a severe flood warning - meaning threat to life - remains in place ahead of a high tide expected at 00:15 gmt .
about 140 have registered at the rest centre in jaywick and police say there is a `` steady flow '' of people going in .

documents.title: 85 jaywick evacuees registered at rest centre so far
text: evacuees escaping a predicted high tide and severe weather , which could cause mass flooding in a small essex village , have been arriving at a rest centre .
the centre in tendring , clacton , can cater for more than 1,000 people who are leaving jaywick .
nigel brown , from tendring council , said that the rest centre had registered at least 85 people .
`` the main issue at that time was going to be the lunchtime high tide that turned out not to be an issue , '' he said .
`` we now have an issue with the tide around 11pm tonight and that looks to be serious . ''

documents.title: safety is the most important priority , says flood minister
text: floods minister therese coffey told bbc essex that she was impressed with the flood preparations in essex .
she said : the most important priority in the next 24 hours is making sure that people are safe .
`` there has been investment [ in flood defences ] along this stretch of the essex coast and there will be in the future . ''

documents.title: 'tried to get in first '
text: minister for the armed forces , mike penning , has praised troops who have been deployed to areas at risk from severe flooding .
`` we like to be in front of the problems , but traditionally we have always waited for the problems to come , '' he said .
`` now we have tried to get in first - to be there alongside the other emergency services and i 'm really proud of what our troops are doing today . ''

documents.title: preparing for a water rise
text: most of the east coast of england is subject to flood warnings , with many hitting `` severe '' , so all preparations are being made .

documents.title: met office weather warnings update
text: the met office has removed a number of its yellow `` be aware '' warnings , but one for ice has stayed in place .
it said that it is likely to form where there have been sleet , snow and hail showers on untreated surfaces , and 2cm to 4cm of snow may fall in low lying areas of scotland .
`` this may lead to the risk of disruption with difficult driving conditions and expect longer journey times . ''
the warning is valid from 16:00 gmt until midday on saturday .

documents.title: flood preparations
text: some residents in mistley , essex , have been laying out sandbags in case of flooding .

documents.title: more severe flood warnings issued
text: the environment agency has now issued 16 severe flood warnings , meaning danger to life .
these are along the east coast of england .
there are also 87 flood warnings , meaning flooding is expected , and 57 flood alerts , meaning flooding is possible .

documents.title: your snowy scene
text: your snowy scene

documents.title: large waves in north east england
text: large waves have been captured by a photographer in seaham harbour in the north east of england .

documents.title: sledging in scotland
text: some people took advantage of the heavy snow in spittal of glenshee .

documents.title: england 's east coast is 'extremely dangerous '
text: the combination of gale force winds , high tides , dangerous waves carrying rocks and a coastal surge means parts of the east coast are extremely dangerous .
our thoughts are with all those who are currently facing another uncertain day and night .
we ask anyone tempted to go to the coast for a thrill or to take to stay away , you would be putting yourself in unnecessary danger . ''

documents.title: 'more than 115,000 properties protected '
text: the environment agency says its flood defences offered protection to more than 115,000 properties overnight and this morning .

it says it has moved more than 8km of temporary barriers and 25 pumps to depots and towns including great yarmouth , chelmsford , ely , newcastle upon tyne , blythe , rye , in east sussex , and south ferriby in lincolnshire .

documents.title: isle of man : ferries and flights cancelled
text: gale force winds have brought down a number of trees on the isle of man and caused disruption on the island 's roads .
the department of infrastructure said its staff had been dealing with fallen trees at numerous locations , including one that fell on live power lines .
winds of up to 53mph ( 85km/h ) forced the cancellation of some flights and the overnight ferry to heysham .

documents.title: essex police : 'comply with police instruction '
text: essex police have called for `` people to comply '' with evacuations so they stay safe overnight .
chief inspector russ cole said : i need residents in jaywick , mistley and west mersea to comply with police instruction and evacuate immediately .
`` latest forecasting tells us that the risk has moved to the next high tide , expected just after midnight .
that threat has led to a severe flood warning being put in place for tonight 's high tide . ''
he said it was safest to evacuate people during daylight hours
`` keeping people safe is our only priority and we will be evacuating residents , '' he added .

documents.title: norwich airport closed

documents.title: 'tonight is going to be horrendous '
text: weather presenter louise lear said whilst the weather situation had been `` generally improving '' since the morning , friday night was going to be `` horrendous '' .
she told bbc news : `` it is a full moon at the moment so the gravitational pull of the moon is at its strongest across the waters .
coupled with potentially strong gusts of winds , which are 60mph at the moment , it could mean the toppling over of flood defences .
`` it is getting better , but we must , must stress tonight is going to be horrendous , with temperatures down to -9 and -10 , which means a potential skating rink for saturday . ''
sunday is set to be cold , damp , drizzly and mild .

documents.title: 'use natural resources against flood threat '
text: professor richard brazier , of the university of exeter , said the uk needed to use the natural landscape to deal with the threat of flooding .
`` allowing coastal flood waters onto certain floodplains can prevent higher-value land , with housing or infrastructure , from being flooded , '' he said .
such land is ty agricultural and will rarely be actively farmed in the winter months when these storm surges are at their worst . ''
prof brazier also said former wetland that had been drained could be used again to store flood water .
such approaches of managing flood water back on to the land deliver proven benefits for wildlife , including wetland birds , '' he added .

please do not go down to the sea defences , it 's a very dangerous place to be .
we are n't out of the woods yet but , fingers crossed , we 'll be able to see through this storm surge together very soon . ''

documents.title: scotland power cuts
text: more than 2,000 homes were left without power in highland , aberdeenshire , moray and angus because of high winds , snow and fallen trees .
a total of 29 schools also closed across scotland .
met office weather warnings are still in place for many parts of scotland , with motorists facing road closures in perthshire and the borders .
a spokeswoman for the met office said the worst affected areas had been in the north of the country , where 18cm of snow was recorded in inverness-shire .
she added : `` it 's going to be another cold day and night and there 's a chance of seeing snow in aberdeenshire tonight . ''

documents.title: safety for livestock
text: a suffolk landlady has been up all night trying to find a safe haven for her livestock .
teresa cook 's pub , the crown inn at snape , was flooded in 2013 .
`` [ we 've got ] a pedigree herd of gloucester old spot pigs that are free range , '' she said .
`` we 've been struggling for somewhere for them to go but this morning i 've had an offer [ of a place ] for them . ''

documents.title: over 1,000 suffolk homes at 'high risk ' of flooding
text: about 1,100 properties in suffolk are at high risk of flooding and plans are in place to evacuate homes and businesses .
the environment agency has warned of two peak times where the risk will be highest - around 12:00 gmt and 21:00 gmt .
police officers will be visiting homes in the affected areas to give people information on local rest centres they can go to .
superintendent kerry cutler , of suffolk constabulary , said : `` we are taking this matter extremely seriously and would urge people in the areas likely to be affected to do the same .

`` rest centres have been established in the county and people in those areas are encouraged to find alternative accommodation outside of the affected areas or make their way to the nearest rest centre well in advance of the high tide times .
`` we continue to work with agencies both locally , regionally and nationally to make sure we are in the best possible position to safeguard suffolk people . ''

documents.title: school closures rising
text: latest figures suggest 29 schools in scotland have been closed this morning because of the wintry weather .

documents.title: environment agency : 'potentially significant effects '
text: environment agency chief executive sir james bevan said he did not think today 's storm would be as powerful as the one that caused the east coast flood of 1953 - described as the worst national peacetime disaster to hit the uk .
however , he told bbc radio 4 's today programme there could be `` potentially significant effects '' including flooding .
he said : `` it 's very important to underline that there are two high tides today coming down the east coast , north to south .
`` the first is coming in at the moment slightly under the height that we expected , the second , due this evening , may come out slightly higher than has been anticipated .

`` we will stay very active throughout the day on the ground , we will continue to warn and inform the communities that are at risk , and i would like to urge everybody to remain vigilant and to continue to follow our flood warnings . ''

documents.title: breakingyarmouth evacuation
text: soldiers and police officers are due to carry out an evacuation of about 5,000 properties in great yarmouth after a severe weather warning was issued .
properties in south yarmouth , north yarmouth , caister , southtown and cobholm areas are being evacuated from 10:00 gmt with additional police resources drafted in alongside military personnel .
high tides and extreme weather conditions are expected tonight , with high water peaking at around 21:15 gmt .
other locations currently identified as likely to be most affected are wells , walcott , salthouse and king 's lynn .
superintendent dave buckley said : `` norfolk has tried and tested flood response plans which are currently in the process of being activated , in line with environment agency advice .
`` a multi-agency co-ordinating group has been convened twice to ensure appropriate plans and resources are in place . ''

documents.title: update : the scene this morning
text: as it stands , there are now 16 severe flood warnings across the uk , mostly focused along the east coast of england .
coastal communities in lincolnshire , norfolk , suffolk and essex have been told they should be prepared for large waves and possible flooding .
in lincolnshire , 100 soldiers have been deployed to warn and inform '' about the potential risks from a flood surge expected to hit on friday lunchtime .
scotland and the north of england were covered in a blanket of snow when people woke up this morning .
the met office has issued severe weather warnings across england , scotland , wales and northern ireland for combinations of high winds , snow and ice .

documents.title: flights from guernsey cancelled
text: guernsey states-owned airline aurigny said it is working on solutions to limit the impact of snow and strong winds due to hit the islands and the uk over the next few days .
the company told bbc radio guernsey that with london city airport more vulnerable to adverse weather than other london airports , it has taken the decision to cancel flights there this morning .
passengers on these flights can rebook on an alternative flight free of charge or cancel for a refund .
it has also cancelled the flight between guernsey and manchester due to the forecast .
flights to gatwick may face delays but are due to operate .

documents.title: lincolnshire : 'threat has passed '
text: the threat from this morning 's predicted storm surge along the yorkshire and lincolnshire coast has passed , according to the environment agency .
leigh edlin , from the agency , told bbc radio lincolnshire the weather `` has been in our favour '' .
however , he added that there was still a renewed risk later today .
`` this evening 's tide will be higher between 18:00 gmt and 19:00 gmt , and there 's still some risk of spray and potential overlapping in this afternoon 's tide , '' said mr edlin .
people living along the north yorkshire and lincolnshire coast should still exercise caution , he added .

documents.title: severe flood warnings up to 17
text: the environment agency has raised the number of severe flood warnings to 17 - the third time it has increased the number in the past hour .
the majority are still on the east coast of england , but there are now warnings for coastlines in somerset , hastings and the isle of wight .
the full details of each warning can be found by clicking here .

documents.title: army officers warn residents of flood risk
text: army officers have been informing residents in skegness , lincolnshire , about the risk of flooding from an expected tidal surge .
some 3,000 residents on the coast have been advised to leave their homes or move upstairs .

documents.title: coastal resorts in north yorkshire 'braced for tidal surge '
text: coastal resorts in north yorks are bracing themselves for tidal surge in early hours of morning .
latest flood warnings etc 10.30pm

documents.title: schools closed in scotland
text: snow and ice have caused disruption to travel networks across scotland , with school closures also reported .
wintry conditions are affecting the highlands , central belt and south of scotland , making travel difficult in some parts .
for more information about the situation in scotland , click here .

documents.title: south east travel update
text: the wintry weather is continuing to disrupt transport around the south east .
in east sussex , the railway line is closed between lewes and eastbourne while engineers check flooding nearby .
network rail said it is not safe to run trains at the moment .
and a tree has fallen onto a line at wadhurst , delaying services between tonbridge and hastings .
gatwick airport cancelled five flights earlier
but the airport said it is sweeping and de-icing the runway to keep it open .

documents.title: travel disruption in london
text: there are long delays on many major roads in london due to snowing , including queues in both directions on the m25 .

several miles of queues have built up between junction 10 and junction six anti-clockwise on the m25 , exacerbated by earlier flooding , while stuck vehicles have caused delays at junction eight clockwise .
train services to heathrow have stopped due to a broken down train , while congestion in croydon has led to delays across the entire london tramlink network .

documents.title: when does snow form ? it does n't need to be freezing
text: did you know ?
# snow forms when the air temperature is below 2 °c .
it 's a myth that it needs to be below zero to snow
@ twitterid but what if it 's 'too cold to snow ' ?
@ twitterid i literally said this in the car hahah
can it be too cold to snow ?
snow is now starting to fall in greater london mixed with rain , rather heavy too .
3c currently .
snow falling on the # malvernhills , # worcestershire .
has n't settled in town , but hills have a nice dusting currently .
hence the saying '' its too cold for snow ''
it 's 2 here in south wales it 's raining what 's with that
what about the saying 'it 's too cold to snow ' ?
the surface air temp could be -1°c but the uppers could be milder so it can rain down at the surface at temps well below 2°c !
this pic makes me want to watch the grinch only rain in central ldn
another myth is ppl think below zero its too cold to snow .
hear it all the time .
loadsa rubbish really
